Since it's set in Sparta, I should consider the historical period when Sparta was prominent. From what I know, Sparta reached its peak during the Classical period of Ancient Greece, around 500-323 BCE. That makes sense because that's when major events like the Peloponnesian War happened.

Now, looking at the publication date of the play: it was published in 1682, but that doesn't indicate when the action is set. The play's setting is likely historical, so I'll stick with Ancient Greece.

Putting it all together, the location is Sparta, and the period is around 500-323 BCE. So timeframe_start would be -500 and timeframe_end -323. 

I should check if there are any other clues in the title or author that might suggest a different time or place, but I don't see any. The title focuses on Sparta, so it's safe to assume that's where the action takes place.

For the Wikidata QID of Sparta, I think it's Q197026, but I should verify that.
